column2: PENNSYLVANIA DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
1. A flashing yellow light:
column4: warns drivers to proceed with caution.
column8: can be found before reaching a sharp curve.

column2: 2. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: find a safe place to stop for a break.
column8: have a beer or two to keep you awake.
column10: turn on the radio to keep you awake.

column2: 3. When driving near a pedestrian using a white cane or guide dog, you should:
column6: slow down and be prepared to stop.

column2: 4. When you drive near parks and playgrounds, you should expect children:
column4: to know when it is safe to cross.
column6: to stop at the curb before crossing the street.
column8: not to cross unless they are with an adult.
column10: to suddenly run into the street.

column2: 5. Drivers may drive around or under a lowered crossing gate at a railroad crossing:
column6: after carefully look in both directions.
column8: if your vehicle can do so without damaging the gate.
column10: after ensuring that no trains are approaching.

column2: 6. The “four-second rule” refers to how drivers should:
7. This road sign means:
8. Blind spots are:
column4: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column6: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column8: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.

column2: 9. Distracted drivers are at a greater risk of a crash when they are using:
10. At night, it is hardest to see:
11. If one of your tires blows out while driving, you should:
column4: apply the brakes firmly and steer toward the right edge of the road.
column6: hold the steering wheel tightly and shift into neutral to bring the front of the vehicle back in line.
column10: hold the steering wheel firmly, slow down, and steer smoothly.

column2: 12. BAC is expressed in:
column4: ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 13. When faced with one oncoming vehicle to the left and a bicyclist to the right, drivers should:
column8: let the car pass and then pass the bike.

column2: 14. This sign means:
column6: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 15. Which shape is a speed limit sign?
16. You may turn left at a red light if:
column4: you are turning from a one-way street onto another one-way street.
column6: you are turning from a two-way street onto a one-way street.
column8: the car in front of you turns left.
column10: there is no traffic coming in the opposite direction.

column2: 17. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Take your foot off the gas and shift to neutral.
column6: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column8: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column10: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.

column2: 18. This road sign indicates:
column10: That you should limit your speed for the next 40 miles
